profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2012-03-29T18:25-0400

did.unittitle: Communist Party of the United States of America Audio Collection
did.abstract: The Communist Party of the United States of America (CPUSA) was founded in 1919 by members of the left wing of the Socialist Party USA. The CPUSA, and affiliated organizations, went on to play a prominent role in the labor movement, in the struggle for civil rights for African-Americans, and in many other campaigns and movements. By the 1940s the Party had achieved considerable influence in the Left, but Cold War prosecution and harrassment of the Party, and shifting currents in the international communist movement resulted in a decline in Party strength after the early 1950s. Nevertheless, in the Civil Rights Movement, in the New Left, and in the gender and ethnic politics of the 70s, 80s, and after, the Party continued to play a significant role. This collection is comprised of the miscellaneous audio tapes found at the New York headquarters of the CPUSA in the summer of 2006. Included are recordings of official meetings of the Party at the national level, such as National Conventions, Central Committee and Political Bureau meetings; as well as meetings of district, state, youth and special-interest organizations. Also included are recordings of public meetings, conferences, rallies, lectures, radio and TV interviews, election campaign materials, and music. NOTE: Items in this collection must be digitized prior to use and are available to on-site researchers only.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Communist Party of the United States of America.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into four series:

Series I: Reel-to-Reel Audio Tapes: Meetings, 1967-1998 Series II: Reel-to-Reel Audio Tapes: Public Events, 1920s-1984 Series III: Audio Cassettes: Meetings, 1966-1999 Series IV: Audio Cassettes: Public Events, 1938-1999.
Items in Series I and III are arranged by governing body to reflect the organization of the Party. Items in Series II and IV are arranged chronologically.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: The Communist Party of the USA Audio Collection was transferred to the Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives as part of the donation of the Communist Party of the USA archives and the Library of the Reference Center for Marxist Studies in the summer of 2006.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Original tapes cannot be played. Digital reference copies of reel-to-reel and cassette tapes must be ordered in advance and may be used at the Library only. For additional information, contact: Peter Filardo peter.filardo@nyu.edu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection is comprised of the miscellaneous audio tapes (both reel-to-reel tapes and audio cassettes) stored in various offices at the New York headquarters of the Communist Party, USA and transferred to the Tamiment Library, NYU in the summer of 2006. Included are recordings of official meetings of the Party at the national level, such as National Conventions, and Central Committee and Political Bureau meetings, as well as meetings of district, state, local, youth and special-interest organizations. Also included are recordings of rallies, public meetings, conferences, lectures, radio and television interviews, election campaign materials, and music. The collection represents a unique resource for the study of internal Communist Party, USA decisions regarding policy, organization and education, and also documents the cultural life and public presentations of the Party, with particular emphasis on Party involvement in and reaction to civil rights and labor movements. Speakers include official Party representatives such as Gus Hall, Herbert Aptheker, Angela Davis, Elizabeth Gurley Flynn, James Jackson, Jarvis Tyner, Charlene Mitchell, and Henry Winston. The tapes also include a wide range of other notable individuals, including W. E. B. Du Bois, Paul Robeson, Studs Terkel, Pete Seeger, Jesse Jackson, Hosea Hudson, Huey P. Newton, Fred Hampton, Ossie Davis, Albert Shanker, Richard Nixon, Rosalyn Baxandall, Vivian Gornick and many others. Included in the collection are a number of tapes recorded in the Soviet Union, South Africa and Cuba.

p.emph: A number of items in the collection have accompanying speakers’ lists or other detailed notations on paper. Items with paper documentation are indicated in the finding aid with an asterisk (*). These paper materials are found in Subseries IV:F.

NOTE: Items in this collection must be digitized prior to researcher use. Please note that many reel-to-reel and cassette tapes are in poor condition. The majority of reel-to-reel tapes will require preservation work prior to digitization. Cassette tapes obviously requiring preservation work are individually noted in the finding aid, although other cassettes may also present digitization challenges.

scopecontent.p: Series I: Reel-to-Reel Audio Tapes: Meetings, 1957-1998, consists of reel-to-reel recordings of official meetings of the Communist Party, USA. These meetings were attended by Party members and guests and were not open to the public. Subseries I:A: National, 1957-1986 Central authority of the Communist Party, USA is vested in the National Convention, held every four years. Between National Conventions, the Central Committee has been the highest authority of the Party and directing all political, organizational and educational work, as well as supervising all departments and committees. This subseries contains recordings of the meetings of national governing bodies and commissions. Included in these meetings are internal reports, workshops, discussions, and speeches. Items are arranged by governing body, reflecting the internal structure of the Party. Subseries I:B: District and State, 1958-1975 Included in this subseries are meetings of district and state organizations, as well as District Convention,s during which delegates to the National Conventions are elected. Items are arranged alphabetically by district and state. Subseries I:C: Youth Organizations, 1964-1972 Youth organizations have been affiliated with the Communist Party since the early 1920s. The W. E. B. Du Bois Clusb, founded in 1964, became the Young Workers Liberation League five years later and remained active until 1983. The records of these two youth organizations are contained in this subseries. Subseries I:D: Miscellaneous, 1967-1980 Included in this subseries are Party forums, discussions, retreats and campaign committee meetings.

Series II: Reel-to-Reel Audio Tapes: Public Events and Messages, 1920s-1984. This series is comprised of reel-to-reel recordings of public events and related material; including speeches, rallies, conferences, radio interviews and election campaign materials, in addition to audio material for film. Subseries II:A: Events, 1920s-1984 Included in this subseries are recordings of Communist Party, USA events which were open to the public, as well as events organized by outside groups. The events include rallies, speeches, conferences, memorial services, and election campaign appearances, among others. Subseries II:B: Radio and Television, 1957-1982 Party members were frequently interviewed on radio and television, and a variety of Communist Party campaign materials aired in support of Gus Hall and Jarvis Tyner during the 1972 and 1976 presidential elections, and for Gus Hall and Angela Davis’ 1980 and 1984 election campaigns. Subseries II:C: Film Material, 1966-1972 This small subseries is comprised of audio material produced for documentary film projects. Subseries II:D: Unidentified, 1965-1976 Containers for these reel-to-reel tapes did not provide sufficient information for adequate identification; in most cases the tapes are too fragile to be played on ordinary equipment. Further efforts will be made to identify them under properly controled conditions. Subseries II:E: Original Containers Original containers for reel-to-reel tapes, numbered and retained when the original tapes were reboxed. Notations on these boxes can be consulted if queries arise as to the contents of individual tapes. Boxes without notations were not retained.

Series III: Audio Cassettes: Meetings, 1966-1999. This series is comprised of cassette recordings of the official meetings of the Communist Party, USA. These meetings were attended by Party members and guests and were not open to the public. Subseries III:A: National, 1966-1999 Central authority of the Communist Party, USA is vested in the National Convention, held every four years. Between National Conventions, the Central Committee has been the highest authority of the Party and directing all political, organizational and educational work, as well as supervising all departments and committees. This subseries contains recordings of the meetings of national governing bodies and commissions. Included in these meetings are internal reports, workshops, discussions, and speeches. Items are arranged by governing body, reflecting the internal structure of the Party. Subseries III:B: District and State, 1969-1993 Included in this subseries are meetings of district and state organizations, as well as District Conventions, during which delegates to the National Conventions are elected. Items are arranged alphabetically by district and state. Subseries III:C: Youth, 1974-1986 The Party's youth organization, the Young Workers Liberation League, disbanded in 1983 upon the reformation of the Young Communist League. Recordings of these two youth organizations are contained in this subseries, which also includes joint meetings of the Young Workers Liberation League and the Central Committee of the Communist Party, USA. Subseries III:D: Miscellaneous, 1971-1996 Included in this subseries are commission and section meetings, conferences, training seminars, recordings of Party conventions that could not be dated and unidentified meetings.

Series IV: Audio Cassettes: Public Events and Messages, 1938-1999, Consists of cassette recordings of public events and related material, including speeches, rallies, conferences, Gus Hall's "Update" recordings, radio interviews, election campaign materials, and progressive music. Subseries IV:A: Events, 1939-1999 Included in this subseries are recordings of Communist Party, USA events which were open to the public, as well as events organized by outside groups and attended by Party members. These events include rallies, speeches, conferences, memorial services, and election campaign appearances, amongst others. Subseries IV:B: Updates, 1985-1993 Beginning in 1985, Chairman Gus Hall produced weekly cassette recordings discussing national and worldwide political trends. These recordings were played at the start of Secretariat and Political Bureau meetings and were also distributed to District Organizers and Clubs. The recordings were intended for internal Communist Party, USA membership and were to serve as a link between the national organization and district bodies. This subseries represents an almost complete collection of the “Update” cassette tapes created by Gus Hall. Subseries IV:C: Radio and TV, Early 1950s-1997 Party members were frequently interviewed on radio and TV, and a variety of Communist Party campaign materials aired in support of Gus Hall and Jarvis Tyner’s campaigns during the 1972 and 1976 Presidential elections as well as for Gus Hall and Angela Davis’ 1980 and 1984 election campaigns. This subseries also contains radio documentaries and programs which were recorded by Party members. Subseries IV:D: Music, 1938-1995 Live and recorded music was featured in Communist Party election campaigns and was used by organizations such as the Young Workers Liberation League and the People’s Daily World at political and social gatherings. This subseries includes music by Paul Robeson, Earl Robinson and Pete Seeger and a number of variations on “The Internationale.” Subseries IV:E: Unidentified Cassette tapes in this subseries contain insufficient information for further identification. Subseries IV:F: Speakers' Lists and Related Materials This subseries contains speakers' lists from meetings and conferences, as well as other materials related to the cassette collection. Cassettes with speakers' lists or other related materials are indicated in the finding aid with an asterisk (*). Subseries IV:G: Original Containers Original containers for cassette tapes are contained in this subseries. These containers may contain additional information.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Communist Party, USA was founded in 1919 by members of the left wing of the Socialist Party USA. The CPUSA played an important role in the labor movement, particularly in building the Congress of Industrial Organizations in the 1930s-1940s, and in struggles for civil rights for African Americans. The Party's cultural initiatives in the 1930s attracted a number of prominent artists and intellectuals, and its struggles to attain and maintain its legality were an important chapter in the history of U.S. civil liberties. Though the importance of the CPUSA declined after the 1950s, the Party remained active in the areas of anti-imperialism, civil rights, labor, peace, and women's rights.
